titleStmt.title: Charles by the grace of God, King of England, Scotland, France, and Ireland, defendor of the faith, &c. to all and every our loving subiects to whom these presents shall come or to whom it doth, shall or may appertaine greeting whereas we ar[e] seized in fee in right of our dutchie of Lancaster of and in the tolle, aswell of carts and wagons laden with wood, corne, oyle, wooll, wine or any kind of merchandizes saleable ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I)

titleStmt.title: Charles by the grace of God, King of England, Scotland, France, and Ireland, defendor of the faith, &c. to all and every our loving subiects to whom these presents shall come or to whom it doth, shall or may appertaine greeting whereas we ar[e] seized in fee in right of our dutchie of Lancaster of and in the tolle, aswell of carts and wagons laden with wood, corne, oyle, wooll, wine or any kind of merchandizes saleable ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I)
Charles I, King of England, 1600-1649.

notesStmt.note: "Giuen at our said pallace of Westmins[te]r under the seale of our dutchie of Lanca[st]er aforesaid the seventh of Aprill in the twelfth yeare of our raigne."
Imperfect: creased with slight loss of print.
Reproduction of original in the Bodleian Library.
